That's why I am excited to moderate Thursday's SOW webinar <http://info.mbopartners.com/31OctWebSOW_RegistrationPage.html>, where we will go over a step-by-step process consultants can use to create an effective and professional SOW. CREATING AN INDEPENDENT CONSULTING SCOPE OF WORK DOCUMENT: TIPS AND A TEMPLATE The scope of work (SOW) is a formal document that captures and defines the tasks, activities, deliverables and timeline an independent consultant will execute for a client project. It is an important tool for independent consultants because the scope determines the boundaries of the client project and can provide the foundation for measuring performance against project goals <http://www.mbopartners.com/blog/how-will-you-measure-success>.
Your scope of work becomes part of your contractual obligation <http://www.mbopartners.com/blog/why-right-contract-matters> to your client, so it is important to clearly delineate the entire scope without being too restrictive. The SOW will also help the client plan internal resources to accommodate the project. The SOW should address the following:
- Work that will be performed - Roles and responsibilities - Timeline for work - Performance measurement - Payment terms
The scope of work may also define how the job is to be accomplished. It is important to clearly define the deliverables and objectives. Ambiguity can lead to misunderstandings and affect the success of your project.

A. MBO will keep track of expenses and provide you with a tax benefit for each qualified expense you would otherwise have to itemize at the end of the year. This eliminates the need to keep that “shoe box” of receipts all year long.
We do this by making it easy, efficient, and convenient for you to submit an expense to us through our online system.
